intro: Krynitzkia trachycarpa, commonly known as the rough-seeded krynitzkia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in grassland or shrubland habitats. Its leaves are usually covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, giving them a rough texture. The flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in clusters, and bloom during the warmer months of the year.
